page.title: 10FARMING IN THE PRISTON AREA
page.content: Farming in the Priston area is mainly dairy and arable. The majority of fields are sown grassland for the Friesian cows. Crops grown include corn, wheat and barley. There is one beef herd, a few sheep and a small pig unit in the area. The farms average 300 acres and are generally worked by a family, with a few full-time workers living in tied cottages and extra help from casuals or contractors. Due to increased wage demands from farm workers, less permanent men are employed these days, as the farmers cannot afford the wages. Mechanisation allows the farmer to cover the workload himself. For some farmers the EEC quotas make it difficult for them to expand so they look for other areas for increased buisness. e.g. Priston Mill farm has instituted 'farm tours' for visitors, mainly school parties.
